Biology_433_r$Biology_53_p$Biology_tweet.text:
Finding A: The damage caused by the heatwave affected the sons of overheated males.
Finding B: EC-MSCs showed high expression for CD90 (96.3 %), moderate expression for CD105 (64.31 %), and low expression for CD73 (23.09 %) while were negative for the leukocyte common antigen CD45.
Finding C: Trade offs in marine protection: Higher #lobster numbers in a #MarineReserve reduced other crustacean species
Finding D: The negative relationship between diet breadth and establishment success suggests the existence of significant fitness trade-offs with diet breadth; these trade-offs appear to be widespread and generally involved in the evolution of dietary specialization in the hyper-diverse taxon of parasitic wasps.

Finding B: Uh oh. instant #ramen linked to #metabolic syndrome.
Finding C: The in vivo expression of Klotho decreases the activation of renal ␤-catenin and improves renal fibrosis in chronic kidney disease .

Biology_33_r$Biology_tweet_6_p$Biology_t.text:
Finding A: The results of the study showed that the regeneration process was most advanced when BMP2 was applied first, with BMP9 added a week after - in this case it led to the growth of more complete joint structures, even with some connections to the bone.
Finding B: We propose that the increased expression of Munc13-4 in cancer cells after epithelial-to-mesenchymal transition combined with increased Ca 2+ uptake drives enhanced exosome release by highly aggressive cancer cells, and that Munc13-4 is a potential target for therapeutic intervention.
Finding C: Host&pathogen ecology drive seasonal dynamics of white-nose syndrome in bats. Another top paper here:
Finding D: Clades characterized by major phenotypic innovations often exhibit higher rates of evolution initially (e.g., [42]); if this pattern characterized most metazoan phyla, rates in the Cambrian would be uniformly elevated .

Finding C: Host&pathogen ecology drive seasonal dynamics of white-nose syndrome in bats. Another top paper here:

Biology_236_r$Biology_68_p$Biology_66_r$.text:
Finding A: They found that infected areas in patients with bacterial skin infections also showed remarkably high salt accumulation.
Finding B: If a new head injury is sustained before complete healing of an earlier concussion, the clinical severity of the second injury is amplified, and recovery is prolonged.
Finding C: This suggests that marine top predators are important in climate regulation, although they are mostly left out of climate models, Nevitt says.
Finding D: Our results showed that PGC1α levels, the master regulator of mitochondrial biogenesis and adaptive thermogenesis 36 , increased upon adipocyte-targeted NaKtide expression.

Biology_417_r$Biology_tweet_29_r$Biology.text:
Finding A: The researchers determined that, while climate change likely has been and will be a factor in the decline of some local populations such as in the Rocky Mountain West -- where the effect of a warming climate seems to be more severe for amphibians -- it is not responsible for the current declines that are occurring.
Finding B: Zebrafish are social. Check out this awesome paper about how they identified what neurons in the brain are responsible!
Finding C: A new mechanism of obesity and T2D that appears to be reversible by metformin
Finding D: By estimating both the mean number of tropical cyclones and their possible year-to-year random variability, we find that the likelihood that the maximum number of storms in the Atlantic could be greater than the number of events observed during the 2005 season is less than 3.5%.

Biology_tweet_14_r$Biology_505_r$Biology.text:
Finding A: Can Far-UVC light help control the spread of airborne-mediated microbial diseases? We test how well our 222-nm technology works on airborne #viruses in our latest publication found on @username (its open access!) #Flu2018 #flu
Finding B: Unlocking the genomic sequence gives scientists unprecedented insights into the unique biology of the koala.
Finding C: Negative selection in cancer, after all...and it\'s also the immune system! Great work by @username @username and colleagues out in @username
Finding D: As SIK1 acts to suppress the effects of light on the clock, this pathway provides a pharmacological target for the treatment of disturbed circadian rhythms, including jet lag, shift-work, and illnesses that disturb circadian timing.

Biology_423_p$Biology_269_p$Biology_239_.text:
Finding A: The extent to which pollinators interact with the same plant species increases with connectance and/or nestedeness.
Finding B: The \uf06dFIP probe can detect pathological activity and then intervene to stop seizures by delivering inhibitory neurotransmitters directly to the seizure source.
Finding C: Although these data showed that BBK32 stabilizes B. burgdorferi-endothelial interactions and extends the force and shear stress range at which they occur by a catch bond mechanism, many questions remain.
Finding D: "Bed bugs evolved unique adaptive strategy to resist pyrethroid insecticides."
Biology_423_p$Biology_269_p$Biology_239_.displayed_text:
Finding A: The extent to which pollinators interact with the same plant species increases with connectance and/or nestedeness.
Finding B: The \uf06dFIP probe can detect pathological activity and then intervene to stop seizures by delivering inhibitory neurotransmitters directly to the seizure source.
Finding C: Although these data showed that BBK32 stabilizes B. burgdorferi-endothelial interactions and extends the force and shear stress range at which they occur by a catch bond mechanism, many questions remain.
Finding D: "Bed bugs evolved unique adaptive strategy to resist pyrethroid insecticides."

Biology_tweet_57_p$Biology_tweet_6_r$Bio.text:
Finding A: Increases in infectiousness as the fungus grows on hibernating bats may drive winter transmission, with loads increasing throughout the winter.
Finding B: Messenger et al. show that exosome secretion in cancer cells is Ca2+-stimulated and dependent on Ca2+-bound Munc13-4. Munc13-4, a late endosome priming factor, acts via a Rab11-dependent pathway to prepare multivesicular endosomes for exocytosis
Finding C: Body nutrient content and trophic position explained little of the variation in EN, EP, or ENP, indicating limited applicability of basic predictors of EST.
Finding D: Notably, we show that IMs highly express Factor XIIIA, which promotes fibrin cross-linking to create a scaffold for LUSC cell invasion and metastases.
Biology_tweet_57_p$Biology_tweet_6_r$Bio.displayed_text:
Finding A: Increases in infectiousness as the fungus grows on hibernating bats may drive winter transmission, with loads increasing throughout the winter.
Finding B: Messenger et al. show that exosome secretion in cancer cells is Ca2+-stimulated and dependent on Ca2+-bound Munc13-4. Munc13-4, a late endosome priming factor, acts via a Rab11-dependent pathway to prepare multivesicular endosomes for exocytosis
Finding C: Body nutrient content and trophic position explained little of the variation in EN, EP, or ENP, indicating limited applicability of basic predictors of EST.
Finding D: Notably, we show that IMs highly express Factor XIIIA, which promotes fibrin cross-linking to create a scaffold for LUSC cell invasion and metastases.

Biology_56_r$Biology_tweet_58_p$Biology_.text:
Finding A: Eating instant noodles at least twice a week was associated with 68% more cardiometabolic syndrome for women, regardless of what else their diet was made up of.
Finding B: Our results reveal a tumor suppressing function arising from the interactions between dynamic subcellular APC network and the adhesion gradient in the crypt, which promotes the elimination of mutant cells with high Wnt signaling.
Finding C: "We found adolescents were not more or less likely to engage in aggressive or prosocial behaviours as a function of the amount of time they devoted to playing violent games," they report.
Finding D: We found that Na + accumulated at the site of bacterial skin infections in humans and in mice.
